rules: Rule1: Whenever the hologram display shows the furniture collection, it is interactive with visitors.
Rule2: Provided that the hologram display has educational content about furniture history, the sculpture is not damaged.
Rule3: If the hologram display has an audio guide, then, whenever it is interactive with visitors, it contains educational content about furniture history.
Rule4: Whenever the interactive exhibit requires a ticket, the museum is open to the public.
Rule5: If the interactive exhibit operates during opening hours, then it requires a ticket.
Rule6: Under the condition that there is supervision by a guard, the interactive exhibit operates during opening hours.
Rule7: If there is monitoring by the camera system, then the interactive exhibit operates during opening hours.
Rule8: Provided that a security guard is present, there is supervision by a guard.
Rule9: Either a security guard is present or the surveillance system is active.

Rule10: If a malfunction is detected in the security system, then, should it not be the case that if the surveillance system is active then there is monitoring by the camera system, an alert is sent to the museum director.
Rule11: Either a malfunction is detected in the security system or an anomaly is detected by the motion sensor.

Rule12: If an anomaly is detected by the motion sensor, then, provided that it is not the case that if the surveillance system is active then there is monitoring by the camera system, an alert is sent to the museum director.
Rule13: Either this action is approved by the director or it is initiated by the technician.
Rule14: Under the condition that this action is initiated by the technician, then, if the puzzle game is removed from room1, it is not displayed in room1.
Rule15: Either this action is documented in the logbook or, if it is approved by the director, then the puzzle game is relocated to storage.
Rule16: If the puzzle game is enhanced with sound effects, then, provided that it is displayed in room1, it is interactive with visitors.
Rule17: Whenever the puzzle game involves the digital painting artwork, it is interactive with visitors.
Rule18: If there is a conflicting schedule with a museum event, then the interactive exhibit is available for use.
Rule19: Provided that there is a conflicting schedule with a museum event, the interactive exhibit is not available for use.
Rule20: Either there is a conflicting schedule with a museum event or, if the puzzle game is updated with a software patch, then it is enhanced with sound effects.
Rule21: Under the condition that the hologram display is tested by the quality team, it is verified as working.
Rule22: Either the hologram display is tested by the quality team or it is inspected by the technician.
Rule23: If the hologram display is inspected by the technician, then, whenever it is interactive with visitors, the sculpture is not damaged.
Rule24: If a repair is scheduled for the hologram display, then it requires maintenance.
Rule25: Under the condition that the hologram display is calibrated by a specialist, then, should it be interactive with visitors, it contains educational content about furniture history.
Rule26: Either the hologram display has a faulty connection or it is adjusted by an intern or calibrated by a specialist.
Rule27: If the puzzle game is curated by the director, then, provided that it is displayed in room1, it involves the digital painting artwork.
Rule28: Either the puzzle game is curated by the director or it is arranged by the technician.
Rule29: If an error is detected by the system check, then the hologram display does not have a faulty connection.
Rule30: Either an error is detected by the system check or a diagnosis is performed by the technician.
Rule31: If a diagnosis is performed by the technician, then the issue is identified as the power supply.
Rule32: If the issue is resolved by replacing the unit, then the hologram display does not have a faulty connection.
Rule33: Under the condition that a permanent solution is implemented, a temporary fix is applied.
Rule34: If the hologram display is secured with an alarm system, then, provided that it shows the furniture collection, the sculpture is not damaged.
Rule35: Provided that the puzzle game is arranged by the technician, it is maintained by the curator.

Rule36: If footage is reviewed by the surveillance team, then either an event is logged by the security system or an incident is reported by the security guard or, should it not be the case that if the hologram display is protected by a glass case then it is secured with an alarm system, a security breach has occurred.
Rule37: Under the condition that the police are notified by the security director, a suspect is identified by the security team.
Rule38: If the puzzle game is maintained by the curator, then, provided that it is displayed in room1, it involves the digital painting artwork.
Rule39: Either the sculpture is damaged or the museum is open to the public.
Rule40: Whenever the wooden chair is placed in the corner, it is facing the hologram display.
Rule41: Assuming the wooden chair is facing the hologram display, the hologram display shows the furniture collection.

Rule42: Provided that it is not the case that if the hologram display is verified as working then, should it be interactive with visitors, the sculpture is not damaged, then a repair is scheduled for the hologram display.
Rule43: Under the condition that it is not the case that if the issue is identified as the power supply then it is resolved by replacing the unit, a permanent solution is implemented.
Rule44: Provided that it is not the case that if the issue is identified as the power supply then it is resolved by replacing the unit, a temporary fix is not applied.
Rule45: Under the condition that it is not the case that if the hologram display is protected by a glass case then it is secured with an alarm system, a security breach has not occurred.
Rule46: Provided that footage is not reviewed by the surveillance team, the police are notified by the security director.
Rule47: Should the museum not be open to the public, then the puzzle game is displayed in room1.
facts: Fact1: The hologram display has an audio guide.
Fact2: The puzzle game is removed from room1.
Fact3: The puzzle game is updated with a software patch.
Fact4: The hologram display is protected by a glass case.
Fact5: The wooden chair is placed in the corner.
Fact6: The puzzle game is not interactive with visitors.
Fact7: An alert is not sent to the museum director.
Fact8: The puzzle game is not relocated to storage.
Fact9: This action is not documented in the logbook.
Fact10: The hologram display does not require maintenance.
Fact11: The hologram display is not adjusted by an intern.
Fact12: An incident is not reported by the security guard.
Fact13: An event is not logged by the security system.
Fact14: A suspect is not identified by the security team.

question: The museum is open to the public.
